page.title: 15Calverton Church
page.content: The stone built church is Early English in style.The west facing tower, approximately 24 metres high, contains a spiral staircase.The church walls are built from irregular sized rectangular blocks of stone.A ridge of carved stone crosses decorate the slate roof which is approximately 12 metres high.Stone animal heads adorn the guttering.The solid wood doorways are decorated with intricate ironwork patterns.Beautiful stained glass windows are well preserved.The south facing porch has a wrought iron gateways,and two small arch shaped windows.A doorway to the north of the church leads into the vestry next to the chancel.An intricate petal and arch design is carved in the wooden stalls. Wooden beams decorated with carved figures support the roof.Red embossed patterns decorate the walls.
